Render the animation of a MOBSTER fit

fit_animation.Rd

Render the animation of a MOBSTER fit

fit_animation(x, density = 0.05, lib = "plotly")

Arguments

x

An object of class "dbpmm" computed with trace = TRUE in mobster_fit.
density

The density of steps in the trace that should be used to render the animation. For instance, 5 n points in the trace, one every n*0.05 is used to animate the fit.
lib

Library used for renderining; this can be either 'plotly' or 'gganimate'.

Value

The animation object, according to the chosen lib.

Examples

data(fit_example)

model = mobster_fit(
fit_example$best$data,
parallel =  FALSE,
samples = 3,
init = 'random',
trace = TRUE,
K = 2,
tail = TRUE)
#>  [ MOBSTER fit ] 
#> 
#> ✔ Loaded input data, n = 5000.
#> ❯ n = 5000. Mixture with k = 2 Beta(s). Pareto tail: TRUE. Output clusters with π > 0.02 and n > 10.
#> ❯ Custom fit by Moments-matching in up to 250 steps, with ε = 1e-10 and random initialisation.
#> ❯ Scoring (without parallel) 3 x 1 x 1 = 3 models by reICL.
#> 
#> [easypar] 2020-04-23 16:24:38 - Overriding parallel execution setup [FALSE] with global option : FALSE
#> [easypar] run 1 - Error in spread(., key = type, value = fit.value): could not find function "spread"
#> [easypar] run 2 - Error in spread(., key = type, value = fit.value): could not find function "spread"
#> [easypar] run 3 - Error in spread(., key = type, value = fit.value): could not find function "spread"
#> [easypar] 3/3 computations returned errors and will be removed.
#> Error in mobster_fit(fit_example$best$data, parallel = FALSE, samples = 3,     init = "random", trace = TRUE, K = 2, tail = TRUE): All task returned errors, no fit available, raising this error to interrupt the computation....

fit_animation(model$best, lib = 'plotly')
#> Error: object 'model' not found
